issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Looks like volume(s) attached to a bfebs instance are failing to re-attach after stop/starting the bfebs instance. Looks like some of the fields are either not present or are getting swapped. See the debug message:
Failed to get connection information for volume 8vO6jR51QXflB8lQmjoanAArQ== from storage controller at: http://192.168.51.72:8773/services/Storage
 
(see log snippet below)

[~shaon] originally spotted this in the logs from a QA run. 

I was able to reproduce this pretty regularly on a DAS backend with the following steps:
1)Run BFEBS instance
2)create and attach volume to the bfebs instance
3)stop bfebs instance
4)start bfebs instance


{code}
30 16:26:16  INFO 000008090 diskutil_dd2             | copying data from '/disk1/storage/eucalyptus/instances/cache/eki-F2D63A8F-c27061ec/blocks'
2013-04-30 16:26:16  INFO 000008090 diskutil_dd2             |                to '/disk1/storage/eucalyptus/instances/work/W5ZZJQ34XEKVM604FMA91/i-470840BE/eki-F2D63A8F-c27061ec.blocks'
2013-04-30 16:26:16  INFO 000008090 diskutil_dd2             |                of 309453 blocks (bs=16), seeking 0, skipping 0
2013-04-30 16:26:17 DEBUG 000000970 doAssignAddress          | [i-470840BE] invoked (publicIp=192.168.46.152)

2013-04-30 16:26:17 DEBUG 000008090 art_implement_tree       | [i-470840BE] implemented artifact 075|eki-F2D63A8F-c27061ec on try 1
2013-04-30 16:26:17 DEBUG 000008090 diskutil_unloop          | detaching from loop device /dev/loop1

2013-04-30 16:26:17 DEBUG 000008090 scClientCall             | 	done scOps=ExportVolume clientrc=0 opFail=0
2013-04-30 16:26:20 DEBUG 000008090 connect_iscsi_target     | connect script returned: 0, stdout: '/dev/disk/by-id/scsi-1IET_000c0001', stderr: 'Before connecting:
After connecting:
$VAR1 = {

'

2013-04-30 16:26:20 DEBUG 000008090 write_xml_file           | [i-470840BE] wrote instance XML to /disk1/storage/eucalyptus/instances/work/W5ZZJQ34XEKVM604FMA91/i-470840BE/instance.xml
2013-04-30 16:26:20 DEBUG 000008090 sensor_set_resource_alia | set alias for sensor resource i-470840BE to 10.174.64.220

fields.summary: NC failing to re-attach volumes during bfebs stop/start (DAS)
fields.environment:
192.168.51.71	CENTOS	6.3	64	REPO	[CLC WS]
192.168.51.72	CENTOS	6.3	64	REPO	[SC00 CC00]
192.168.51.73	CENTOS	6.3	64	REPO	[NC00]


EBS_STORAGE_MANAGER=DASManager

comments.body: I'm looking into this. I suspect that the CLC is calling Attach on the volumes but not getting a new volume token for each. I'll look at the stop->start code in the CLC and confirm. I don't see problematic code in the NC at the moment.

Found the problem. There was a copy-paste error in the CLC where I modified it to use the token-get rather than AttachVolume() and it was accidentally using the root volume id in a few places where it should have been using the non-root volume id.
[~zhill] does it affect the overlay backend as well? I have seen it few days ago on a setup with overlay.

Yes, it would be in both since the error was in the CLC. It is likely in other backends as well. I just committed some fixes that should resolve it (and other things), but I haven't had time to test for this specific bug yet. I will update/resolve this ticket when I test it explicitly tomorrow (today).

Just added a new commit to fix this issue: see 448f144644b976fca63a84d11713071650a06bfc

Should fix segfaults and attach failure on stop-start for all backends.

Ran through sequence 3.3 smoke as well as manual testing for stop-start with volumes attached.

Tested manually with EMC backend. Verified volume attached and available inside VM after stop-start cycle.

Also passed the 3.3 smoke test suite.

[~zhill]: Volume that was attached after the instance was running was not visible in the instance after the instance was stopped->started. I've been using fdisk -l command to list the attached devices in the VM instance. I did not see any corresponding errors in nc.log or the cloud-output.log on SC. 

When I tried detaching the same volume (post stop-start operation) I saw errors on the NC and SC

Error in the nc.log
{code}
2013-05-26 22:58:54 DEBUG 000011889 cleanup_volume_attachmen | [vol-750741A9] attempting to disconnect iscsi target
2013-05-26 22:58:56 DEBUG 000011889 disconnect_iscsi_target  | disconnect script returned: 0, stdout: '', stderr: 'Tried deleting lun 1 0 times in iSCSI session IP=10.107.1.200, IQN=iqn.1992-08.com.netapp:sn.702150347fa211e28d14123478563412:vs.3
Tried deleting lun 1 0 times in iSCSI session IP=10.107.1.201, IQN=iqn.1992-08.com.netapp:sn.702150347fa211e28d14123478563412:vs.3
Tried deleting lun 1 0 times in iSCSI session IP=10.108.1.200, IQN=iqn.1992-08.com.netapp:sn.702150347fa211e28d14123478563412:vs.3
Tried deleting lun 1 0 times in iSCSI session IP=10.108.1.201, IQN=iqn.1992-08.com.netapp:sn.702150347fa211e28d14123478563412:vs.3
'
2013-05-26 22:58:56 ERROR 000018189 scUnexportVolumeStub     | operation on 10.111.1.2 could not be invoked (check SC host, port, and credentials)
2013-05-26 22:58:56 DEBUG 000011889 scClientCall             |  done scOps=UnexportVolume clientrc=1 opFail=0
2013-05-26 22:58:56 ERROR 000011889 cleanup_volume_attachmen | ERROR unexporting volume vol-750741A9
{code}

Error in the cloud-output.log on the SC
{code}

[~zhill] confirmed that the attached device not showing up in the VM instance is an intermittent issue and can be resolved by rebooting the vm outside of euca. Opening a new bug to track errors on detachment failure
